intro: Fuirena rottboellii, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Fuirena rottboellii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
